content.description:
Start on the left side sitting down. The is a good foot way to the left and very slopey holds heading up right. Make a few moves right before popping big to a decent arete way out right. Bear hug a few moves until you can gain a hollow jug and climb on top. 

  Sloper skills with a side of explosive power will be the recipe for this little number.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location:
A bit tricky to find but it is just down in to the talus from the left end of the cliff. Not quite as far over as Heat Wave but close.  

  Easiest to find by walking past Numb Thumb and continue scrambling toward the left end of the cliff. Check out the pics so you know what you are looking for.

content.description:
Not to be confused with the one-move wonder at Blair Woods, this hideous problem is really not worth it. It is dirty, condition dependent, tiny, a little sharp, contrived, and climbs even worse than it looks. 

  Sit start on the base of the very short arete with both hands on dirty, sloping nothings and an awkward right heel. Work your way up the short arete with mossy holds and slippery feet and finish the love up with a beached whale into the dirt. A candidate for the worst problem in the park.
content.location: If you are looking at 'Red Devil', then turn around and on your right you should see the short, blunt arete. Walk off the back.

content.description: Sit-start the base of the left-leaning arete. Pull-on with some slick feet and body-tension and follow the arete up and left until jugs can be reached!
content.location: This boulder problem is located on the same boulder as "Red Devil". It is found in the top left part of the Den in between the Big Boss Boulder, and The Decomposing Walrus Boulder.

content.description: A super hard mantle testpiece. Start at the lip of the roof on a nice shelf feature. Mantle the shelf and somehow reach up to the next lip of the boulder. A tiny thumbdercling could potentially be quite useful!
content.protection: 2 pads. There is a pit under the roof that is a bit sketchy, but sliding down into it has not been an encountered issue as of yet.
content.location: This Boulder problem is found just left of "Broken Piercing" and is also located behind and left of the Red Devil Boulder.

content.description: Sit start the short left-leaning arete on some juggy pinches. Make a few moves up the arete before figuring out which side you want to mantle on. This problem provides a good intro to arete-tension for those gyms\ rats who need their finger buckets and crimps in order to climb a route.
content.protection: 1 pad. There may be some poison ivy in the area as well!
content.location: This climb is found in the upper tier of the talus-field right near "Red Devil". When staring at the mentioned boulder, turn 90 degrees clockwise and walk right 10 yards. There is a short roof with a giant sloping shelf, this climb is found to the right of this sloping shelf.

content.description: Sit start with the right hand on a bad sloping pinch on the arete feature. Find a small micro left-hand sidepull, and a foot before pulling onto the wall and jumping out left to the other arete. Keep compressing both aretes before moving up to a hollow jug flake for the topout.
content.location: This boulder problem starts on the middle arete in-between "Red Devil" and "Dirt Devil".

content.description: This area is somewhat hidden in the talus-field. The boulders are smaller but well worth the effort of the approach.
